reviewText:
Wailing Heights is an adventure game that build on great music and lovely artwork.

+ The soundtrack is amazing
+ All dialogues are with voice acting
+ Great artwork
+ Nice setting
+ Overall very atmospheric
+ Unique story with a twist (that I won`t spoil for you)
+ Nice popculture jokes and references, did I told you that your lawyer is called Saul Ghoulman?! ;)

- Had a few bugs in my version, but this was a prerelease copy to make a walkthrough (further below) and the developers fixed it
- Also: sometimes the background music was too loud (again this is supposed to be fixed with the day 1 launch patch)
- Game length could be longer, act 1 and 2 each take around 2-3 hours while act 3 is only 10 minutes long. I would have loved to see more of the world
- Pathfinding isn`t always optimal (especially if you walk behind" other characters you may walk into them occasionally)
- Note for the developers: Do a hint or questlog in your next game so you have an overview as a user what to do next.

I made a walkthrough for the game if you get stuck

reviewText: Excellent adventure with many pop culture references. Enjoyed the music but main selling point is the comic book artwork. Logical puzzles, completely voiced game and devs who fix issues quickly make Wailing Heights a steal at $10 and easily recommended.\nhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xoa508z_YI8&index=1&list=PLslfvIJAupsyvGAWnWLejKjx5bpQnXGO4
voteText: 20 of 27 people (74%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Wailing Heights is an approachable and fun adventure game. It doesn't have illogical puzzles, or a vast number of items that you don't know how to combine, it's streamlined (in a good way). As long as you pay attention to the surroundings, and the dialogue, then most solutions will come to you quickly.

The voice acting is really good, the music will get you singing for sure, and the characters are cute, and comical but also make sense, in a weird way. There are also lots of pop culture references that will make you smile throughout.

The graphical style works great I think, and it allows for some really detailed characters, and vibrant surrounding, all without needing a lot of resources.

Wailing Heights has greatly polished elements (graphics, music, dialogue, characters) and you can see that a lot of heart and soul went into making it.

Quick note, I played (and finished the game twice) with the keyboard/mouse but there's also controller support.

If you want to see more of Wailing Heights, and hear about how it was made check out the developer interview/live stream here
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SPyny1d-gc8

reviewText:
A fun, bizarre, puzzle adventure game.

The best way I can describe it is CAMPY.  Like a B horror flick this game is full of bugs, missing odd pieces of voiced dialogue, limited voice actors and subpar recording, goofy glitchy visuals, and some corny music.

But for all that the games just bursting with heart. All the problems above almost add to the ambiance and sense of the game. The characters and world is bursting with color, amazing detailed enviroments, and while some of the music is silly and repetitive, the main hits in the game are really catchy. The game also features beautiful comic styled cutscenes that all really fit the vibe of the city.

Some of the puzzle aspects are somewhat vague, and if you miss something small you may be stuck for a little while, but overall the game does a good job of guiding you between objectives. The possesion mechanic is great albiet a little confusing at times when trying to solve puzzles that require specific characters.

So while this game is definitely unpolished and rough, it manages to do well with what it has, and over all a very enjoyable experience.  One has to wonder if the developers had the means to really polish this game what it may have been, and if maybe it's almost better this way...
voteText: 7 of 8 people (88%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Wailing Heights is a musical adventure game with lovely comic book art style, impressive voice acting and engaging story.\n\nThe game kinda reminds me of The Wolf Among Us" by Telltale Games.Sadly there is no "make your own story" element or any choices to make at all.It's all about getting to know each monster type in Wailing Heights to progress.Almost every creature has its own personality and yes
date:
you are going to hear the same line of dialogue over and over again but it's never annoying because of how good the voice acting is.

The game runs well without any FPS issues at all.In fact it will most definitely run above 60 FPS on any old potato.The resolution is locked to 16x9 so you either have a 16x9 monitor or you are running in windowed mode.The music is amazing and fits the theme perfectly.
Played both with a controller and keyboard and they both worked absolutely fine for me.It's really all about personal preference.

Everything else I could possibly say about the game might be a spoiler and ruin your playthrough.Experience Wailing Heights for yourself

reviewText:
A Musical Comic-Style Adventure Gamehttps://youtu.be/2Kc-LcbxDVE
+ A great soundtrack filled with indie pop / soul music
+ Gameplay is pretty fun as you are able to possess and take control of other characters by first learning some things about them and then singing a few lines about them.
+ Great voice acting and every character seems to be very interesting
+ Some of the comic style environments look amazing, great use of depth, color, and detail
+ Lots of dialogue options

- The one downside is that there's not a whole lot of gameplay besides walking around and interrogating people, but I suppose that's the case with most adventure games.

reviewText: Reminds me of playing an undead version of The Monkees television show.  The storyline is fun, the music is pretty awesome.  If you enjoy point and click adventures with a sense of humor, than this is for you.  The art is also pretty wonderful.

reviewText: Definite recommendation if you like puzzle adventure games. I really loved the humour, music and visual style. No wonder after I've learned that Todd Mcfarlane was involved whose comic series SPAWN had outstanding artwork, too.\n\nFor me it was a really, really fun time exploring the town Wailing Heights and I would love to experience another story with all those ghosts, werewolves, zombies and vampires^^

reviewText:
To say this game isn't usually my type of thing would be an understatement. Having said that I found this game to be quite refreshing.

Art is fantastic.
Music is Awesome.

And the artistic/comic book feeling is definitely a fun change from all usually games you play now days.

Highly reccomend for anyone looking for something new.

reviewText: Gorgeous looking puzzle game with a terrific body-swap concept that means just having the right item isn't enough - sometimes you have to be the right person, too.\n\nThe only downside is that it's very short - I breezed through it in under four hours, and few of the puzzles are actually challenging; the clues are all there.

reviewText:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=p_QG9mIkvPA

A pun filled, witty and unique comicstrip story. Classic Scooby Doo inspired atmosphere.
Graphics, animations, and art style fit perfectly with the humor and plot.
The game focuses on the player finding their way to progressing the story forward.
I have to give credit to all 2 voice actors that did all the voices for each character in the game.
A few audio glitches, but i'm sure those will be remedied.

10/10

reviewText: Although I'd say this game brings outstanding gameplay elements, and offers a genuinely good experience. As of right now, it's much too buggy. I've been sent outside of the map several times, and some times, it can ruin any progression you've made thus far. I'll have to check back in later to see if these glitches have been patched.\n\nEdit: Turns out whatever was wrong with my game, had to do with my FPS. Even though I had a problem, I don't want it to turn anybody off from this game. If you're half interested, just buy it. It's a super fun and entertaining, and the developers seem super cool and on top of things!

reviewText:
Wailing Heights is an unsual and attractive looking game with very original content. There were some good music references and fun with the names of characters. I liked the overall look of the game, and the concept was interesting. Where I felt the gameplay was let down a little was the repetativeness of certain elements.

There appeared to be two Acts to the game and I liked the idea of splitting these, as Act 2 felt like a new part to the game. But I felt there should have been a final Act 3, maybe with a little more to do with finding 'the body.' Which seemed to become a little redundant towards the end of the game.

The music was very original, and fair play to the writers and voice actors used. But the same music playing over and over did get quite tedious after a while. Especially when I found myself waking up in the morning and the 'Betty the Banshee' one line on repeat in my head. I maybe should have looked to see whether there was an option to turn off the music within the game. Also I found the length in which it took to switch characters during the game started to annoy me a little. Especially when you had to listen to the whole of the song each time. Lola's loves and hates are now etched into my brain.

Unfortunately this wasn't a game I really loved. It had its moments and some fun elements, but I found the gameplay repatative, especially towards the end and the final part of it quite a let down. I would still recommend this for the price and it's original content. Just I honestly have to say for me I would have liked a little more variety and some more streamlined elements.
